abstract:
We investigate theoretical and practical aspects of algorithms for CIRCUIT-SAT and SAT based on combinatorial parameters.
Two such algorithms are given in [1] and [4] based on branch-width of a hypergraph and cut-width of a graph respectively.
We give theoretical generalizations and improvements to the cut-width-based algorithm in [4] in terms of many other well-known
width-like parameters. In particular, we have polynomial-time backtrack search algorithms for logarithmic cut-width and path-width,
n

O(logn)-time backtrack search algorithms for logarithmic tree-width and branch-width, and a polynomial-time regular resolution refutation
for logarithmic tree-width. We investigate the effectiveness of the algorithm in [1] on practical instances of CIRCUIT-SAT
arising in the context of Automatic Test Pattern Generation (ATPG).
